alert.note: Alert for Bennington; Western Windham (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 2:11PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Bennington and northwestern Windham Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 211 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Arlington, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Arlington, Manchester, Stratton, Shaftsbury, Manchester Center, West Wardsboro, Windham, Jamaica, Sunderland, Wardsboro, Sandgate, Glastenbury, Wardsboro Center, Beartown, Goose City, Chiselville, South Windham, Barnumville, East Dover and East Jamaica. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southern Vermont.
